description:
As the new semester begins at Ooezo Agricultural High School, Hachiken is now used to the tough lifestyle of a rural, agricultural high school. While Hachiken still wonders what he will do in the future, he continues to discover both the harsh and the beautiful realities of the countryside.

(Source: Anime News Network)

node.description:
Her self-portrait is usually that of a bespectacled cow, as she was born and raised in a dairy farm with three older sisters and a younger brother. Arakawa started out as [Etou Hiroyuki's](https://anilist.co/staff/98901/) assistant writer for [Mahoujin Guru Guru](https://anilist.co/manga/34080/) and a friend of [Shakugan no Shana](https://anilist.co/manga/33074/) author [Yashichiro Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/99114/). Arakawa's career started with a work titled [STRAY DOG](https://anilist.co/manga/33303/), but she is best known for creating the [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/manga/30025/) world and manga. The author is friends with [Akira Segami](https://anilist.co/staff/97387/).

Due to a lack of real publicity photos of Arakawa, a great sum of her fanbase has no idea what she really looks like, even to this day. There are some scarce pictures of the real Arakawa in the web, but they are very low in quality and are rarely used as reference. Many fans have mistaken photos of [Romi Park](https://anilist.co/staff/95082/Romi-Park), Edward Elric's seiyuu, as photos of Arakawa, because of the set-up in one particular image in which Romi Park poses as a mangaka. Romi Park is known for representing Arakawa in public appearances, in which Arakawa is not able to attend. 

_Awards:_
• 1999: 9th 21st Century Enix Award for "Stray Dog"
• 2003: 49th Shogakukan Manga Award, Shōnen category for "Fullmetal Alchemist"
• 2011: 15th Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize, "New Artist Prize" category.
• 2011: 42nd Seiun Award, "Best Science Fiction Comic" category for "Fullmetal Alchemist"
• 2012: 5th Manga Taishō Award for "Silver Spoon"
• 2012: 58th Shogakukan Manga Award, Shōnen category for "Silver Spoon"
• 2013: 1st Contents Award of Japan Food Culture Grand Prize for "Silver Spoon"
• 2023: 1st Rakuten Kobo's E-Book Manga Award, "I Want to Read it Now! Featured Manga" category for "Yomi no Tsugai"
• 2023: 7th Tsutaya Comic Award for "Yomi no Tsugai"

__[Website](https://www.fujifabric.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fujifabric_info) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/fujifabric) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/fujifabricSMEJ)__

__Formed:__ 2000

__Biography:__
Fujifabric was initially formed by Masahiko Shimura in the early 2000s and consisted of five members. They released their first mini album in 2002 titled _A la carte_, and later made their major debut with "Sakura no Kisetsu" through record label EMI Music Japan (known as Toshiba EMI at the time) on April 14, 2004. 

After being active for 9 years, the band would go through a sudden change when Shimura died at the age of 29 on December 24, 2009. At the time the band consisted of four members, Masahiko Shimura, a vocalist and guitarist, Souichirou Yamauchi, a guitarist, Daisuke Kanazawa, a keyboardist, and Shinichi Katou, a bassist. The remaining members decided to continue band activities as a three-piece band, with Souichirou taking over as the vocalist.

__Members:__
- Souichirou Yamauchi (山内総一郎) – vocalist and guitarist
- [Daisuke Kanazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/209456/Daisuke-Kanazawa) (金澤ダイスケ) – keyboardist, lyricist and composer
- Shinichi Katou (加藤慎一) – bassist

Goose house was a band formed in 2010 and disbanded in 2018. The fourth original members (Manami, SAYAKA, Shuhei Watanabe and Shuhei Kudo) went on to form [Play.Goose](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCx66obAJ42B0XwHIm_iupkw).

__Members:__
d-iZe (lead vocals, piano, trumpet)
Kei Takebuchi (vocals, recorder)
Migiwa Takezawa (vocals, acoustic guitar, piano, cajon, drums)
Shuhei Kudo (vocals, guitar, harmonica, human beatbox)
Johnny Saito (vocals, guitar, bass, mandolin, violin, banjo)
Manami (vocals, guitar)
Sayaka (vocals, piano, harmonica)
Shuhei Watanabe (vocals, guitar, bass, ukulele, drums)
**Mori Akitoshi (森彬俊)** is a Japanese producer affiliated with Fuji TV.
Masaki Nawata was the chief editor of Shuukan Shounen Sunday between 2009 and 2012.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tk_mogi)

Color designer who works frequently with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures).
Shin Toriyama is a producer and licensor.
Kouichirou Natsume is representative director & president of Aniplex company.
Hiro Torimitsu is a manga editor.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/42231474)

The founder and representative director of [Twin Engine](https://anilist.co/studio/6199/). Originally a producer for [Fuji TV](https://anilist.co/studio/169/), where he produced numerous anime for the Noitamina programming block.
